intro: Senecio discodregeanus, commonly known as the Cape mountain star, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features a compact, rosette-shaped growth pattern with thick, fleshy leaves that store water, enabling it to thrive in arid environments. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers during the summer months, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is well adapted to rocky and sandy soils, often found growing in mountainous regions. Due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
